column4: i am trying to change from gnome to xfce, but it is hard, i am now getting used to gnome now
for example, the gedit is more convient for me, but in xubuntu ,there is xedit,(though you can install it
all of the experience i accumulated about ubuntu are all under gnome
xfce is pretty similar to gnome...kde is quite different
then what is the important you think?
and gnome is a compramise between the two
idk about that...kde and gnome are sort of the two main window managers in gnu/linux
the user interface is so important nowadays
I think too much emphasis is put on the GUI these days
the junior users needs an high accessibility and avalibility
i try to turn to xfce simply because i think xfce will improve the performance of the cpu, less usage of cpu, i can do computing things more quick
I use to run xubu on a p3 laptop
you can't run gnome apps in a console window
mneptok , also i want to add a keyboard shortcut for openning a terminal, but i can not find the way
